item.title: Ballard Jazz Walk 2014
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded: Went and saw McTuff at the Lock and Keel tonight during the Ballard Jazz Walk.  They were hella tight, as always. I guess a pass for the Jazz Walk was $30, but my buddy Tom and I got in for free, since we're regulars... score! There was some dude from New York there, who was way stoked on the show, so I clued him in on the Seamonster in Wallingford, where McTuff plays every Tuesday: Seamonster Calendar

item.title: Easy Street Records
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded: It's 6AM and I'm waiting in line for Record Store Day at Easy Street Records in West Seattle. The line is longer than I thought. I also thought they were going to open the cafe at 6, but they didn't, so now I'm just cold. Trying to get Built To Spill's first time ever release of Ultimate Alternative Wavers, and Soundgarden Superunknown for my buddy Ed. They only let me buy 1 Built To Spill, and Superunknown doesn't come out till June 3rd. There was some 10" box set that came out today. This place is a madhouse!

item.title: Marginal Way Skatepark Pour April 2014
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded: There's a Marginal Way Skatepark  pour today.  Come down and help, or bring beer!

item.title: Bluwater Bistro
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded: Mmmm the Bluwater Bistro on Greenlake makes really good Scrambled Eggs.  And my buddy Ed the bartender makes some killer drinks.  Get your Easter brunch on with a beautiful view of Greenlake.

item.title: Lost Lake Cafe
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded: Lost Lake Cafe in the heart of Capitol Hill, has great diner-style+ grub, and is 24 hours.   Clean Dining Area   Sweet Owl Menu   Get your standard Pancakes Eggs and Bacon, Burger, BLT, or this yummy Curry Tofu Scramble   Sweet Northwest Decor   The Guys bathroom looks like the Black Lodge from Twin Peaks

item.title: Everyday Music
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded: Everyday Music is yet another kill record store.  This one's big, with a lot of variety of vinyl, cds, dvds and other stuff.

item.title: Last Gasp - Highline
item.dc:creator: jaemzware

item.title: Delridge Skate Park
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded: My favorite skate park, aside from Marginal Way. And lucky me, it's right on Delridge Way in West Seattle (just off the delridge exit), practically in my back yard. There are 3 main parts of the park to skate: the egg bowl, the flow bowl, and the outer track (including China Banks). All very fun and totally shreddable. This is a very large panoramic photograph. Click it to open in its own window.

item.title: Seattle Photos
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded: I don't know what it is ,something in the water maybe, but a lot of my friends out here LOVE to take pictures. Not just point and shoot with their phones though. Nice pictures. Pictures not only worth a 1000 words, but worth 1000s of dollars (to produce).  Their cameras are fancy.   These are from my buddy Shawn.  We call him Beer For Breakfast.  He let me use a photo for the background, so I'm giving him credit. Also, he's going to be taking glamour shots of me shredding the gnar at various Seattle Skate Parks this Summer, so look out for those [caption id="attachment_170" align="aligncenter" width="635"] Ballard Bridge by Shawn Gilson[/caption] [caption id="attachment_171" align="aligncenter" width="1024"] Space Needle by Shawn Gilson[/caption] [caption id="attachment_168" align="aligncenter" width="960"] Pioneer Square Side Streets by Shawn Gilson[/caption]

item.title: Suffering Fuckheads
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded: Seattle has a badass Jazz scene. My friend Rob turned me onto these dudes a few years ago: The Suffering Fuckheads Two dudes: Ron Weinstein (B3 Organ) Mike Peterson (Drums and Stompboxes), with occasional guests. They play the Seamonster , Olaf's, and Hattie's Hat regularly, no cover (donations appreciated).   Check it, you won't be disappointed. More songs can be found at http://seattlenative.org Please let me know if this site is down (it shouldn't be, but sometimes it is).

item.title: Cinco De Margo
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded:
[caption id="attachment_206" align="aligncenter" width="891"] Marginal Way Skatepark - Cinco De Margo[/caption]
Today, May 4th 2014, Marginal Way Skatepark held its annual Cinco Del Margo celebration. There were tacos, raffle, beer, shredders, more shredders, bands, and ... A NEW SECTION OF THE PARK! There was a really good turnout, and I'm sure a good amount of money was raised, that will go towards finally finishing the park after 10 years of blood, sweat, crete and beer. I have footage of the Fakies set, and will post that here as well soon.

item.title: Crack Sabbath - Darrells
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded:
Seattle's own Crack Sabbath played two sets at Darrells Tavern in Shoreline last night. All-star cast  Skerik, Ron Weinstein, Keith Lowe, Mike Stone, and Brad Mowen brought it, big time.  Probably my favorite set of theirs ever. It was an epic 3 hours of earth shattering hardcore jazz. Don't miss these guys next time they play.  You won't be disappointed. Download .zip of all 25 tracks (MP3s) here.

item.title: Greenlake Skatepark
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded: I haven't been to this park in almost a year. I hit it a lot when I was doing the "skate every day for a year" challenge, but haven't really been back since. Probably because I live in West Seattle, and there's really no need than to go to Delridge, in my own back yard. Anyway, I haven't skated with my buddy Clint in a long time either, and he suggested we shred Greenlake, so I gave it a go. It's a kickin park, with a street area, flow bowl, and pool-style bowl with a ring of blue tiles (Big Blue, some folks call it).  I had all my old lines back.  It was fun. Greenlake is just a nice, refreshing place to kick it in general.  What's really cool about this skate park, is kids that skate can drag their whole families, because there's so much other stuff to do, for the non-skaters in the family: runners, walkers, roller-gapers, wrong-boards, tennis players, bikers, soccer players, softball players, kickball players, cross country runners, etc.. [caption id="attachment_310" align="aligncenter" width="627"] Greenlake Skatepark Pano[/caption] [caption id="attachment_311" align="aligncenter" width="816"] Greenlake Skatepark[/caption]

item.title: Lock and Keel
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded: In the heart of Ballard Avenue lies the Lock and Keel.  I've been hanging out here quite a bit since 2011.  Very chill place. If you like boats and all things that float, you'll love the decor.  Especially the outboard motors for pool table lights. If you do play pool, this is the place to do it.  The tables are only 50 cents, and there are chalk boards for putting your name in a play-the-winner queue, so you don't have to be like, "hey, my quarters were sitting there first!"  I think they still do free pool Thursdays too. It gets pretty packed with kids in their early 20s on Friday and Saturday night, but not as bad as Kings Hardware.  There's still an older crowd too, to balance things out. Food is pretty grubbin.  Especially since they smoke their own meat.  And I haven't tried it, but I guess the chili mac is the bomb. I think my favorite thing about this place is they're very straight-edge friendly.  Once I got kicked out of another bar for just playing pool, and not ordering drinks.  The Lock and Keel is very cool about that though.  They never hassle me, and are always ready to re-fill my coffee and water. Drinkers are in good hands as well.  Good spirits, wines and beers.  And if Danelle or Caitlin are working, you're stoked ... they'll take good care of you.   [caption id="attachment_377" align="aligncenter" width="490"] Lock and Keel - just look for the boat on Ballard Ave[/caption]   [caption id="attachment_360" align="aligncenter" width="490"] Lock and Keel - you can watch the cook in action[/caption] [caption id="attachment_371" align="aligncenter" width="490"] Lock and Keel - that's about the size of it[/caption] [caption id="attachment_370" align="aligncenter" width="490"] Lock and Keel - back patio.  No smoking though, just the occasional stoner[/caption] [caption id="attachment_369" align="aligncenter" width="490"] Lock and Keel - Tommy P shooting pool.  Watch out though, he'll beat you and make you cry.[/caption] [caption id="attachment_368" align="aligncenter" width="490"] Lock and Keel - look at all those spirits.  And that bow above them is pretty cool.[/caption] [caption id="attachment_365" align="aligncenter" width="490"] Lock and Keel - oh yeah, there are TVs playing sports.  [/caption] [caption id="attachment_364" align="aligncenter" width="490"] Lock and Keel - cool crew boat on the ceiling[/caption] [caption id="attachment_363" align="aligncenter" width="490"] Lock and Keel - nice rudder[/caption]   [caption id="attachment_362" align="aligncenter" width="490"] Lock and Keel - check the spearfish in the back of this photo[/caption]

item.title: Beth's Cafe
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded:
What do night owls do after a busy night of bar hoppin' in Seattle?  They keep the party goin' at Beth's Cafe!  That's right, all hail the most righteous 24 hour diner in Seattle, just across the Aurora 7-11 by Greenlake. They have a lot of diner food, but I typically go for breakfast, as it's served 24 hours a day.  Breakfast plates come with bottomless hash browns. Other than that, their monster omelettes, shakes, burgers, french dips, and bacon are to die for. You like coffee and water?  They don't let your cups go less than half full.  It amazes me.  At 2 AM on a weekend night they are slammed.  Sometimes you have to wait up to 45 minutes for a table (pro-tip, you can just sit at the counter if you're alone).  Yet, they manage to have plenty of time too keep everyone's coffee and water full. And for the artist in you, they'll provide paper and crayons, then proudly display your work on the wall.  Sometimes they have drawing contests too.  I once got a free shake for winning 2nd place in a Rated X Sesame Street drawing contest. Other Pro-tips:
  • when they are super busy, they won't let you put your name down for a table till your whole party is there.
  • there's parking in the back.
  • you won't be able to finish the six fiddy shake alone.  It's extremely rich (Chocolate, Peanut Butter & Brownies.)
  [caption id="attachment_355" align="aligncenter" width="490"] Beth's Cafe - 60 years strong.  Beat out the Twin Tee Pees[/caption] [caption id="attachment_354" align="aligncenter" width="490"] Beth's Cafe - front shot, where the smokers hang[/caption] [caption id="attachment_359" align="aligncenter" width="490"] Beth's Cafe - seat yourself bar[/caption] [caption id="attachment_358" align="aligncenter" width="490"] Beth's Cafe - watch the cooks in action.  They're good.[/caption] [caption id="attachment_357" align="aligncenter" width="490"] Beth's Cafe - good juke box.[/caption] [caption id="attachment_356" align="aligncenter" width="490"] Beth's Cafe - game room, for when you have to wait for a table.[/caption]

item.title: Big Business - Vera Project
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded: Took my son to his first Hardcore show last night: Big Business and the American Sharks. It was at The Vera Project, where it's All Ages all the time, so he didn't need fake ID (he's 19). Big Business recently put out a new album, Battlefields Forever, and they played it LOUD. American Sharks were jammin' as well. We loved it.  Short set, but they killed it! Here are some photos and videos. [caption id="attachment_389" align="aligncenter" width="367"] Big Business - Vera Project - 06/11/2014[/caption] [caption id="attachment_390" align="aligncenter" width="490"] Big Business - Vera Project - 06/11/2014[/caption] [caption id="attachment_391" align="aligncenter" width="367"] Coady Willis - Big Business - Vera Project - 06/11/2014[/caption] [caption id="attachment_392" align="aligncenter" width="367"] Scott Martin - Big Business - Vera Project - 06/11/2014[/caption] [caption id="attachment_393" align="aligncenter" width="367"] Jared Warren - Big Business - Vera Project - 06/11/2014[/caption] Download .zip of all tracks (MP3s) here.

item.title: Jefferson Park - Beacon Hill
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded: Jefferson park is super fun for street and bowl riders alike. Plus, it has lights till 11:30pm. And a great playground for non-skating kids. Here's a nice pano of the park. Could be the best view in the city. Here's ultra-shredder Payton ripping the bowl. This is the new sculpture on the North end of the park, that's built to skate.

item.title: ATS Indoor - Fremont
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded: Went and shredded Seattle's only indoor skatepark today, All Together Skatepark.  $10 all day session, or $5 5pm-7pm session.  It's between Wallingford and Fremont [caption id="attachment_416" align="aligncenter" width="612"] All Together Skatepark[/caption] Here's the main floor. [caption id="attachment_417" align="aligncenter" width="816"] All Together Skatepark[/caption] Here's the other side.  Kinda like the old Innerspace setup, but without the mini :( [caption id="attachment_418" align="aligncenter" width="816"] All Together Skatepark[/caption] They have plenty of equipment for rent. [caption id="attachment_419" align="aligncenter" width="612"] All Together Skatepark[/caption] The shop is open.  Boards and stuff for sale! [caption id="attachment_420" align="aligncenter" width="612"] All Together Skatepark[/caption] Another shot of the park from above. [caption id="attachment_421" align="aligncenter" width="816"] All Together Skatepark[/caption] Pano shot. [caption id="attachment_422" align="aligncenter" width="627"] All Together Skatepark[/caption] Tom Peha casually shredding.

item.title: Seattle Pride Parade 2014
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded: Today Seattle had its 40th annual Pride Parade.  I had no idea it was that old.  And I'm a little embarrassed to say, as a native only a year older than this parade, I've never been to one.  Or maybe I have, but just don't remember it.  I'll remember this one though.  It was amazing.  All 4 hours of it (longest parade in the world maybe?). When I got off the bus on 3rd and Virginia, I had no idea where a good place to watch the parade from would be.  I found this spot on a whim.  Lucky for me, it was right in front of these lovely Emcee Queens.  They were very informative and damn hilarious. [caption id="attachment_610" align="aligncenter" width="490"] Seattle Pride 2014 Emcee Queens[/caption] George Takei showed up   [caption id="attachment_613" align="aligncenter" width="490"] Seattle Pride 2014 George Takei[/caption] So did Ernie and Bert [caption id="attachment_488" align="aligncenter" width="490"] Seattle Pride 2014 Ernie and Bert[/caption] Macklemore was there too, there's a video clip of him below. For now, here's a giant balloon octopus. [caption id="attachment_433" align="aligncenter" width="490"] Seattle Pride 2014 Balloon Octopus[/caption] Even the Space Needle raised the Pride flag.  Because Seattle rules.  In Seattle, you can be who you want, and it's cool. [caption id="attachment_590" align="aligncenter" width="490"] Seattle Pride 2014 Space Needle[/caption]

item.title: Mark Lanegan - Showbox Market 2014
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded: Saw Mark Lanegan at The Showbox Market.  The crowd was pretty thin, because he opened for Nick Cave the night before, and that was totally fine by me.  The less annoying, drunk strangers the better. The whole set was acoustic, with no drums.  Pretty sick.  He even did a Screaming Trees song, Where the Twain Shall Meet Download .zip of all tracks (MP3s) here [caption id="attachment_653" align="aligncenter" width="627"] Mark Lanegan - Showbox 2014[/caption] [caption id="attachment_654" align="aligncenter" width="627"] Mark Lanegan - Showbox 2014[/caption] [caption id="attachment_657" align="aligncenter" width="627"] Mark Lanegan - Showbox 2014[/caption]

item.title: Zippy's Giant Burgers - Rat City
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded:
Best Burger in Seattle comes from Zippy's, in the heart of White Center (Rat City).

There are many menu options, and everything is made to order.

Quote: "We make our burgers using 100% chuck that we grind on site each and every day."

I'm pretty sure they hand-pack the patties too.  Analog burgers.  Everyone loves analog.

There's a ton of burger memorabilia to keep you entertained while you wait for your food.

And video games

Lots of great soda.

Their special sauce is the bomb... good for fries, rings, and burgers.

All burger options are available with veggie patties as well.

Zippy's burgers will make you happy.

Every now and then they host free punk shows in the parking lot.

You really couldn't ask for more.

item.title: Marginal Way Skatepark Pour August 2014
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded:
Marginal Way Skatepark is almost complete (till we poach the trucker lot across the street too).

This pour is special to me. I've been shredding this park since its beginnings in 2004. When I skated 365 days in a row (2011-2012), Marginal Way Skatepark was easily my most visited, with 105 sessions there that year. I've met so many friends there, and have had so many kill sessions. I've especially been waiting for this section to be complete. I saved up money I'd usually spend on smokes, weed, and alcohol, and made a donation that covered a large portion of the crete for this pour. I wanted to give something back to a place that has been a large part of my life and sanity.

The park is amazing. Built completely by local skaters volunteering their time. Thanks dudes. You rip.

item.title: World Extreme Pencil Fighting League
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded: EXTREME PENCIL FIGHTING RULES (Official WXPFL Blog): Two challengers face off, each armed with a regulation wooden pencil taken from a factory-sealed pack. The only recognized regulation competition pencil is the Dixon/Ticonderoga #2 yellow – graphite core, cedar shaft, latex eraser with aluminum stay. The pencil may not be sharpened or altered in any way prior to initial combat. A Pink Pearl Eraser flip determines which fighter strikes first. The loser of the eraser flip becomes the “Defender” and holds his or her pencil between both hands in a horizontal position. The winner of the eraser flip becomes the “Striker”, holding their pencil vertically and bringing the pencil down in a strike across the opponent’s pencil with full force, attempting to break it in two. If the Defender’s pencil does not break from the Striker’s attempt, then it becomes the Defender’s turn to strike. This repeats until one player’s pencil breaks in two and cannot continue. If a pencil is cracked, but not fully broken in two, referee determines whether said pencil can continue. If both pencils break during a strike, victory goes to the striker. TIME LIMIT RULE – If neither competitor’s pencil breaks before the announcers get bored, the announcers will impose an arbitrary number of strikes before the end of the round. At the end of the round, each player will get one penalty shot with the penalty pencil of their choice, with a pink pearl eraser flip to determine who strikes first. If by this point neither competition pencil is broken, the referees will declare a winner based on style, aggression and pencil control. STRIKING RULES: The striker may position their striking hand as they like, and may hold the eraser end up or down, but the exposed striking area of the pencil must be a minimum of 2 1/2 inches. (Ex: If the eraser end is pointed up, the striking hand must not cover past the “A” in Ticonderoga.) Striker must not have more than one hand on their pencil at point of contact. Using more than one hand during a strike is a major penalty (see Offensive Bracing). The striking pencil must be swung or flicked in an attempt to be horizontal at point of contact. Holding the pencil vertically and pounding, attempting to make contact with the flat of the eraser or unsharpened end (aka “The Piledriver”), may result in major penalty or disqualification. FOULS: PENALTY STRIKES – If either player commits a FOUL (whether a Major Penalty or a Minor Penalty) during a turn the referee may award a free PENALTY STRIKE. PENALTY PENCILS: The free strike may be taken with ANY pencil from the striker’s pencil bag. These pencils are known as “Penalty Pencils” and are allowed to have ANY alteration the competitor deems necessary, but MUST have originally been and continue to be some manner of working wooden pencil. No pens, mechanical pencils, rubber or plastic-fused pencils allowed. MAJOR PENALTIES: Penalty strikes may be awarded for the following fouls at the referee’s discretion: Dropping the pencil – either defending or striking, don’t ever drop your pencil. Dipping - Lowering or dropping one end of the defending pencil during the striker’s swing. Defensive Bracing aka “Bridging” - Using the fingers or thumbs to support the defending pencil within the exposed strike zone during the strike. Offensive Bracing aka “Chopping” – Using the fingers or thumb to excessively support the attacking pencil during the strike. (see Striking Grip) Stalling - Only 30 seconds are allowed between strikes. Grip Shifting – Using the hands to reduce the potential strike zone is allowed, but the strike zone may not be smaller than three pencil widths (approx. 1 inch). You can change your grip from strike to strike, but changing your grip during the upswing of the opponent’s strike is a major penalty. Illegal use of hands – Touching the opponent’s body in any way other than striking the hands with a pencil during regular match play is a major penalty. MINOR PENALTIES: Cumulative Minor Penalties aka The Bloody Knuckle Rule – A fighter can accumulate up to FIVE minor penalties, one for each knuckle. The FIFTH minor penalty triggers an automatic major penalty and a free penalty strike for the opponent. If the penalized fighter’s pencil survives the penalty strike, his bloody knuckle count restarts at zero and the fight continues. Knuckle Strikes - The most common minor penalty is the deliberate or accidental striking of the opponent’s knuckles or hand. If the referee feels the knuckle strike was deliberate or egregious, they may call it a major penalty and assign an automatic penalty strike. Missing outright aka “Whiffing” - Managing to miss your opponent’s pencil with your strike is a minor penalty, and is added to your cumulative minors. TOURNAMENT PLAY RULES: All rules of regular Extreme Pencil Fighting are observed. The pencil the fighter chooses at the start of his first match MUST be the same pencil that is used throughout the entire tournament. The tournament may contain any number of competitors or rules variations. As of 1/19/2012, the contendership for the WXPFL Championship is determined by The Lottery of Lead Tournament. Lottery of Lead Match Rules: Two fighters begin the match, each drawing a new pencil from an unopened pack of 24. When one fighter is beaten, a new fighter comes in, until 12 fighters have battled it out. Audience members will compete, as well as eligible stars of the full roster of WXPFL Pro Gra-Fighters. Entry order is determined by random drawing during the match. Double-break tournament rule: In case of a double break during a strike, victory goes to the striker. However, the victor may only advance in the tournament if their pencil is 3/4 intact or greater, with final decision of pencil’s fighting condition resting with the referee’s discretion. The Championship Belt: Winner is declared WXPFL Pencil Fighting Champion, the winner’s pencil is placed in the belt, and the belt is kept by the WXPFL champion until his next defense. The same championship pencil stored in the belt must be used to defend the title. Pencilmania Open Audience Tournament: The Open Audience Tournament contains 8 amateur Gra-Fighters. If competitors don’t bring their own penalty pencil, an arsenal of penalty pencils will be provided to choose from. All competitors choose a pencil at the start of play and must use the same pencil throughout the tournament. If you win your matches, you advance through the tournament to the finals. Winner of the tournament wins a tournament trophy, prizes from WXPFL sponsors, cash prize, and a contract to become a WXPFL Pro Gra-Fighting Megastar and be featured in future WXPFL events.

item.title: Melvins - Showbox - 10/18/2014
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded: Melvins played the Showbox last night for their "Hold it In" tour. It was Buzz, Dale, and Butthole Surfers bassist JD Pinkus. Power trio. They lit the place up. Unfortunately no encore, but killer set. They did the Butthole Surfers tune Moving to Florida with Buzz singing. So good. Other tunes I recognized from the Melvins: Night Goat, Youth of America, The Bit, Sweet Willy Rollbar and a few others.

item.title: Skate - 365 - revisited
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded:
In Fall of 2011 I made a resolution to skate everyday for 365 days.  It was mostly for health reasons, physically and mentally, but I also just wanted to be a better ripper.  Anyway, I succeeded. Here's a graph of the parks I visited. [caption id="attachment_896" align="aligncenter" width="901"] 2011-2012 Skate Everyday Graph[/caption] When I was done, I took a couple months off.  A little burned out.  After a while off though, I felt like a sloth, and decided to get active again.  My doctor said I needed to do something a little more vigorous, so I started alternating between skateboarding and going to the gym over the days.  At first I just did the elliptical for a half hour at the gym.  I found that it was great cross training for skating.  As I built up my legs at the gym, they got a lot more steady on the board.  Eventually, I upped my time at the gym to an hour, where I'd lift weights for a half hour, then do the elliptical for a half hour.  And I got to be more comfortable on my board than ever. After a while of this routine, my weight plateau'd; even though I was exercising everyday, at either the gym or the skatepark, I wasn't losing weight.  And I still have more to lose, so I'm going to up my routine.  I'm going to skate everyday again, except this time, I'm going to run, speed walk, and/or lift weights everyday as well. It's pretty hard to skate everyday in Seattle.  Especially through the Fall and Winter.  This time, however, I'm armed with a key to the Marginal Way Skatepark, where I can bring out the generator and power on the lights when it's dark.  Jefferson is also a go when it's dark, but Marginal is a requirement when it's dark AND wet.  Except when the wind blows rain and snow sideways, even Marginal gets wet.  Fortunately, thanks to Evo and All Together Skatepark, I can still skate on days like that.  Also, the Red Square garage is no longer a bust, so I got that as well. Here is my log for 2014.

SKATE365

20141203 60 ballard

20141204 60 marg

20141205 40 redsquaregarage

20141206 20 marg

20141207 60 jefferson

[caption id="attachment_899" align="aligncenter" width="816"] Jefferson Skatepark Bowl Section[/caption] [caption id="attachment_900" align="aligncenter" width="816"] Jefferson Skatepark Bowl Section[/caption] [caption id="attachment_901" align="aligncenter" width="816"] Jefferson Skatepark Street Section[/caption] I plan to do this for at least 365 days in a row (my son says I should "do it forever"), and will post updates here (or posts with a similar title).  Most parks will be in Seattle, because Seattle Rules, and we're like a Skatepark capitol of the world.  But some I will skate abroad. 20141208 30 wseattlestreet This is what I call a survival session. Dark, wet, late, indoor park closed, don't feel like driving all the way to marg, but still gotta skate to keep the 365 alive. I scoped a lot of covered spots around West Seattle. There aren't many. And the ones you think should be dry, aren't. This was the best I found. There was a garage nearby, but didn't feel like getting busted yet. [caption id="attachment_907" align="aligncenter" width="612"] West Seattle Survival session[/caption] 20141209 60 marg [caption id="attachment_908" align="aligncenter" width="816"] Night sess at marginal, with a ripper from TTown[/caption] 20141210 60 ats [caption id="attachment_909" align="aligncenter" width="816"] Van fire outside of ATS skatepark[/caption]

20141211 60 marg

[caption id="attachment_914" align="aligncenter" width="640"] Marginal Way Backside Grind over light[/caption] 20141212 22 zimsgarage 20141213 40 marg 20141214 30 marg 20141214 30 lwrwoodland 20141215 30 elliptical 20141215 60 jefferson 20141216 30 marg [caption id="attachment_922" align="aligncenter" width="816"] Marginal Volcano at Night[/caption] 20141217 60 marg 20141218 30 marg [caption id="attachment_923" align="aligncenter" width="625"] Marginal Night Pano[/caption] 20141219 60 delridge 20141220 60 gym 20141220 60 ats 20141221 30 marg 20141223 30 marg 20141224 60 magnoliastreet 20141225 40 downtownstreet 20141226 15 auroraskatenearbeths 20141227 60 marg 20141228 60 ats 20141229 60 jefferson 20141230 30 roxhill 20141231 60 northgate Oh man I've been slacking, and not sure if I want to keep doing this.  The first day of 2015 I ran 5.5 miles, then skated roxhill (street park) for an hour.  I didn't wear my pads because i thought roxhill was "just a street park" and therefore "safe."  i was sadly wrong.  pulled a mary lou (gymnastics trick without being a gymnist), a.k.a. mr. wilson and ended up hurting both my knees.  The 10 days of carpet boarding and PT (Physical Therapy) followed.  That sucked.  Note to self: wear pads no matter what! 20150101 60 roxhill 20150102 1 carpetboardPT 20150103 1 carpetboardPT 20150104 1 carpetboardPT 20150105 1 carpetboardPT 20150106 1 carpetboardPT 20150107 1 carpetboard PT 20150108 1 carpetboardPT 20150109 1 carpetboardPT 20150110 1 carpetboardPT 20150111 1 carpetboardPT 20150112 30 jefferson 20150113 1 carpetboardPT ok, keeping the dream alive. knees feel good. 20150114 90 delridge 20150115 60 vashon 20150116 60 marg 20150117 120 marg 20150118 120 marg 20150119 60 marg 20150120 60 marg 20150121 110 marg 20150122 60 marg 20150123 60 uw garage 20150124 240 margpour 20150125 60 judkins 20150126 30 jefferson 20150127 35 weatseattlestreet ... 20151231 60 jefferson

item.title: 1st Seattle Trip 2015 - by Kayla
item.dc:creator: jacob
item.content:encoded:
My brother Jacob and I went to Seattle to see my dad the 1st of January. Jake and I have always loved going out there, it's so wonderful that our so caring dad lives in such a wonderful, beautiful place.
When we first got there we went out to eat. Ever since we were kids we have always loved the seafood from Ivars. Although we didn't go to the one on the pier, we still got our fried clams and clam chowder fixes!
Daddy surprised us when we got home to gifts sitting underneath our "Christmas tree" which was really the leg lamp off of A Christmas Story. Dad or "Santa" got me a pair of boots that I love and wear a lot, I was actually very surprised he knew my taste!
This visit we got to see a lot of our family, we had them over for spaghetti! We watched home made movies from 10 years ago and helped grandpa with new technology while my brother and dad went to a concert.
We also did a little shopping. I bought some new running shoes for getting straight As my first semester of Junior year. I also bought the 1st and 2nd Harry Potter books which I've already finished!
Me and Jakes Christmas present this year was a trip to New York to see our all time favorite Belle and Sebastian! We are going in June, it sure is something to look forward to and I'm super excited to go out on the town and shop!
i love my dad and brother so much. They are my favorite boys in the whole world. They treat me like a princess and I am so thankful to have two protectors like them! I'm grateful for everything they do for me.

item.title: Discovery Park, Seattle WA
item.dc:creator: jacob
item.content:encoded:
Discovery park is a beautiful place to hike, run, jog, swim, or walk your dog. Some of my favorite memories revolve around this park. Although my brother, dad, and me have a hike completely off the path, the other paths are very beautiful as well.
When you first start on our unmarked path there's a big wall made of dirt that everyone carved into. Carvings range from "Kate + John", to a penis, to a beautiful drawing of a person with a big nose. Recently I haven't drawn on the wall, there's always but bees by it so I get scared.
After the wall made of mud there's a very steep hill made of sand that you can run down for 5 seconds. My brother and I always race while our dad yells "doe!" Like Homer off of the Simpsons and "ow!".
After the steep hills and plants to get through, you're on this beautiful beach. I love to collect "sea glass" which is glass that has been broken but has been there for so long that the sharp edges has been weathered down and the sea has turned the brown or green glass into beautiful colors. I also collect seashells.
A lot of time there's mud and we have mud fights. We also find a lot of things on the beach such as crabbies, washed up tires, dead animals, and even a washed up car. When the tide is out, all the rocks are also out and whenever you lift up the rocks dozens of crabs swarm all around.
The hike back up is on a path and it is surrounded with beautiful trees and plants and very spacious wonderful views. It's beautiful, but very very exhausting.
I love this hike with my dad and brother. I highly suggest taking a hike at Discovery, or taking your pet. It's super fun for a family day or even just to spend some time with yourself.

item.title: Pioneer Square Hotel
item.dc:creator: jacob
item.content:encoded:
Pioneer Square Hotel - Genuine Hospitality, Plus many other Personalities

A brief explanation as to why Pioneer Square Hotel is definitely one of the must-visit hot spots in the city. Having working there for an entire summer, the staff is nothing more than willing to help accommodate you and your needs while staying the hotel's fine hospitality.   It's not because of the fact that this dork worked there at one point, as a bellhop... ... But Pioneer Square Hotel is also known for being close to many familiar areas in Seattle! There's Ye Olde Curiosity Shop, The Great Ferris Wheel, CenturyLink Football Stadium, SafeCo Baseball Stadium, Seattle's Waterfront, Magic Mouse Toys (a toy store in case you didn't know), and the worldly known Smith Tower! So if you're looking for the full Seattle experience and only have to walk a few blocks, don't hesitate to book a reservation at Pioneer Square Hotel @ 77 Yesler Way! You won't regret your decision, once you enjoy not just the warm accommodations from the fantastic staff, but the overall of experiencing the true spirit of Seattle and its genuine personalities.

item.title: Mt. Ranier
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded: Nearly everywhere in Seattle there's a great view of Mt. Rainier towering over the southern horizon. And every time you fly into or out of Seattle, you get a breath taking birds eye view of it. Here are a couple shots I took from a recent flight.     An even better view, if you're into snow sports, is the view from Crystal Mountain Ski Resort, which is butted up pretty much right next to the volcano.  Sometimes it's hard to catch it on a sunny day though.

item.title: ATS Indoor - Fremont Updates
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded: When ATS first opened, the old guys griped about there not being a mini in the layout. Now there is! Winter shred sessions are a go! [caption id="attachment_1109" align="aligncenter" width="980"] Relatively new mini ramp at ATS indoor, under EVO in Seattle Washington[/caption] The funny story is I was one of those old guys, but could not resist going to ATS, despite the fact there was only street skating to be had. There aren't a lot of dry, lit places in Seattle during the Winter months... let alone warm. Anyway, after hitting mini-less ATS for a while, and moving right down the street from Roxhill skatepark last Summer, I like the street more than the mini, and don't care so much anymore.

item.title: North Star Diner
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded: YES!! ANOTHER 24 HOUR DINER IN SEATTLE: The North Star Diner!! (87th and Greenwood, next to Safeway) You can never have too many 24 Hour diners. This one is the newest gem. These guys took a run down sketchy Chinese Karaoke Restaurant, and turned it into a 24 Hour diner for all ages on one side, and a Bar with Awesome karaoke on the other side. I had the Little Dipper, but promise to get the Steak and Prawns next time. item.title: Skate'Crete Or Die
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded: skatecreteordie skatecreteordie is a skatepark locator map for world class, concrete skateparks. black pins represent world class parks based on quality of construction and/or design, gray pins represent other parks, and yellow pins represent parks with lights, regardless of quality. tap a pin to see its name, then tap the details button in the bottom tab bar to see additional information and photos. photos can be zoomed and panned. tap the photo to download and view the next. each park has at least 2 photos. this app can be run without an internet connection; however, photos will not appear, unless they have been downloaded beforehand and the app has not closed. not every skatepark is shown on this map. only concrete parks. the only exception are wood ramp parks that are covered and have lights.re will also be more photos and descriptions. email support and feedback

item.title: Spokanimals 2004
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded: [paypal_donation_button align="right" border="10" price="5"] [caption id="attachment_1230" align="aligncenter" width="1024"] Electric Limewire[/caption] When I was in Fairfax mental institution in 2004 I saw the most striking girl. Around 5’5, green eyes, thin frame, sandy blonde, small chest, about 23 years old, and wearing a lime green prom dress. She walked in from admittance (probably just attempted suicide), and looked weary of everyone in the place. She sat by me and said, “I guess I’ll just sit by you ok?” Her voice was high pitched yet velvet-toned. There wasn’t much of any dialog between us because I was too shy. All I said was “ok.” We just sat there, content with each other’s presence. The next day she was gone, which was unusual because people don’t usually leave those places the day after they’re admitted. Maybe she was an angel, got transferred, or succeeded in her suicide. I chose to think she was an angel, and have spent many a mania looking for her, Light Girl. When manic, I don’t hear voices, I absorb thoughts. And in the height of my mania Light Girl’s thoughts become one with mine. She’s not a ghost or imaginary friend, we share my body. Sometimes her voice echoes from my lips, and sometimes she smiles with a gnashing grin. She protects me from mental harm. When I think of my ex-wife, she’ll snap “fuck that bitch.” When I’m uncomfortable with a situation, she’ll advise to “get the fuck out.” When Light Girl does not possess me, I search for her human form; I literally search for the girl in the lime green prom dress. This has gotten me into a great deal of trouble. Once upon a time trouble began at a skateboard park… I was skating some simple lines in a skateboard park, when suddenly I felt as if all the skaters could hear the songs playing in my head. They would follow me around and make requests; I could absorb their thoughts as if they were requesting songs from a DJ. Then one of them actually spoke “God save the Queen.” At that moment I looked up and the sun was speaking to through its rays: Light Girl, my Queen, was near, and if I followed signs closely, I could find her manifestation. More prominent rays shone on a house across the lawn from the park I was skating in. I thought “that’s it! That’s where she is,” so I walked over and knocked on the door…only to find an angry neighbor exclaiming “who the hell are you?!” and “get the hell out of here!” I continued walking, following the sun’s rays all over town, and into the outskirts. I probably walked 20 miles in a manic tizzy trying to find my angel. When night fell I found myself back at the skate park, too tired to walk any further. I took a nap in the bottom of a bowl in the park with a black attaché case over my head for warmth. Once I awoke, I abandoned my search and decided to check into the Red Lion hotel for some rest and relaxation. Only to find, in fact, I was hot on the trail. The girl at the Red Lion check in counter had an incredibly familiar chemistry about her; as if Light Girl’s soul had penetrated her body. She was a tad heavier than the girl in the lime green prom dress, but I knew it was her … just wrapped in a different body. The conversation was light, but our eye contact and body language was locked tight. At one point I absorbed a thought from her loud and clear that said, “I want to see that picture of you and your beautiful children.” Without even thinking about it, I pulled out a recent church picture of my children and me. She exclaimed “Not THE picture,” looked around (to ensure no one noticed this exchange), and threw another thought saying, “I need your ID.” I gave her my ID, and got a room key in return. I’d expected to run into the same girl that night (maybe she’d come knocking on my door), but I was terribly wrong. I turned around and saw the back of a very tall man staring out the front door. He was wearing a dark brown suit and top hat, and holding a dark black (neon black) brief case. His presence made me shudder and shrink. I just stared at the back of him for a time, transfixed. He didn’t move nor make a noise. I sensed he was waiting for me to do something, and was there to assist in some way. Afraid he’d turn around to face me, I sped up the elevator and up to my room. His presence followed me, however; I left his body in the lobby, but the Tall Man (as I call him) had some sort of metaphysical grip on my mind. As I opened the door to my room on the 5th floor, the Tall Man spoke (in thought absorption) “Have some coffee.” Sure enough, a hot cup of coffee was sitting next to the TV waiting for me. I picked it up and started to sip. It was a very dark roast, my favorite, and made me feel right at home. I sat down and watched TV for a while, then went into the bathroom. The tub was full of water. The surface of the water did not look normal. It was covered in a silky substance and riddled with tiny bubbles. The Tall Man told me (thought absorption again) that Light Girl’s soul was in the bath water. And that I needed to immerse myself, swallow some, and then split my body in two to be with her. He was there to assist with the splitting process, and all I needed to do was follow his instruction. So I got in the bath water. It was freezing cold. I looked closely at the water. There were millions of tiny particles swimming about in different directions. I went under water to completely immerse myself. My body chilled from the cold and tickled from her soul. I raised my head, hesitated, but then took a sip. Immediately I felt the possession of her soul in my body. It was warm, comforting, and her thoughts were again one with mine. My body was no longer cold. We were one again. I discovered Light Girl did in fact succeed in her suicide, and was now with me from the afterlife. Her purpose was to come back to life to be with me. And my body was to be the host of her newly formed body, which would be exactly like her old one. The Tall Man was there to help with the splitting process that would create the newly formed body. Now that’d I’d drank the coffee (some magic blend) and swallowed Light Girl’s soul, I was ready to take part in some human mitosis. The Tall Man instructed us to remove everything from the bed but the bottom sheet, and then told us to lie face down on the sheet. With my hands cupping my groin, I began breathing heavily into the sheet and excreting all the saliva and mucus I could muster up (as if my body had done this before). After about 10 minutes of heavy breathing, my face was just blowing bubbles in a puddle of spit and snot. “This isn’t working” I thought, then had Light Girl take over the breathing; I surrendered my body mechanics to her soul. She took a deep breath, and then exhaled into the pillow with cheeks full…I felt my nose sink into the sheet through the pool of puss, splitting into two and parting either way as it descended. The splitting process was not painful, just extremely bizarre. It was like body parts I never knew I had were regaining consciousness from numbness, and growing. Next, I simultaneously noticed my lips splitting two mouths as my hands separated covering opposite sexual organs. Suddenly two hearts were beating. All this while breathing heavily into the pillow like clockwork with progression of the split synchronized with every exhale. Suddenly realizing I had 4 arms and 4 legs flapping under two faces I spoke “are you ok?” and she, now my other face, responded “yeah.” Just then a clock tower bell tolled outside. It was midnight. Part of me wanted to see my reflection in the mirror; the other part was scared to death of that reflection. The Tall Man warned “This is more critical than surgery. The only thing keeping you animate is the sheet, that is, until the process is complete. Get up from this position, and you’ll become a dead mound of flesh.” He then continued, “To complete the splitting process you need to suffocate yourself in the pillow, so the lungs can be properly divided.” I didn’t want to die. I’d attempted suicide once several years before, and could not do it again. This got me to thinking “there must be a better way.” I beseeched the Tall Man to find another way...perhaps there were aliens out there who could complete the process without my having to die. Just then a low hum sounded above the Red Lion Hotel, and my body entered complete numbness and was being pulled upward. To his reluctance, the Tall Man had summoned help from another world. Suddenly my body was one again; I lifted myself up as my skin reluctantly pulled itself away from the clammy sheet. Pieces of flesh were scattered across the bed, and, to my chagrin, a pile of dried up cow dung. The aliens helped complete the split without my having to die, but not without payment: they took my Light Girl. Following, for the first and only time in my life, I checked myself into a mental institution. The End.

item.title: The Abstinent Marriage
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded: Where do you start? Where's the court? It can take awhile I’ve waited years before You can’t force a flower to bloom It has to want to Force becomes impending doom And a no-brainer loom over your guilty head Throw a rock on it And take a breather Decade or two does a body good When you love yourself Shit don’t matter But your matter matters In waives of cell driven promises at a tear level Pick a trinket and cry on it for awhile Tears are very good at forming new dreams New dreams that grow The echo of your thoughts get heard around the world Every cell of earths black core becomes your corps Cherry swirl beach bomb bingo prom Check it I was going out with this girl once A super ego I’d never witnessed before Passed up the bomb prom for witches and moms Because I was asked It was a gas Hottest girl I’d seen since the early years Only on par with the one I also already loved Asked my ass to go “sorry, I have a girl already, but i will ask my dear sweet swedish princess anyway” “yeah dude, it's ok, i'm just a junior at garfield anyway. i'm cool with spec. i know you liked her for like the longest sec ever, so go and have fun” "you're an angel glistening in the sun" still we never touched at prom and it was fun she's always been the bomb a lesson she taught me, the non-careerer, only to rear it’s head decades later the thought of loving no jealousy (thank you swedish princess) freely given as was freely received when I reached back to touch where I came from I fell on my head Dumb Id been learning the wrong way Tit for tat Ledger of rats Nuclear families Suck and drats Not MY thing anyway Though mine only thing I have obvs daughter issues even kinda gay Alas I’m not I gather my snot And form newly weds in hay So now, check out this today We don’t have to touch But you need And what you don’t have Is where my non-greed will kneed Take it kid It’s yours Build it out of spray paint, decks, trucks, wheels, beats, spits, and more only to soar Into an outside you I can’t handle a world without love like yours You’ve already done your part Hell is the smoking section of a mental hospital Where I’m comfortable and warm Could be a little darker With a little more dirt But whatever I will never say no Peace and love Just for you Your struggle is the only real one Peel off its skin and fashion a raven Then just fucking walk the fuck away Bloody eyeD bitches wont see another DAY item.title: TAK (DANISH FOR THANKs) JACKL 2016
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded:
TAK (DANISH FOR THANKs) JACKL 2016
 
Make no mistake
My “friend” breather of volcanoes
I was scared shitess
When I saw you descend
I almost offered you a smoke
Because your shirt was off too
Then I watched the people clear
THE FUCK OUTTA THE WAY
Blackie orb
Because they knew it was you
You turned to me and said
Nice work kid, nice head
First student you’ve earned and will never be dead
 
I didn’t know you ever took flesh
But when you did, my eyes became mesh
 
If you really love her like that though
I’ll build with you every step of the way
It was just black and white in the beginning
Until we put in some green
Lush green became lush green American shit money
Greed greed greed growing over us
Spark a fire and I will blow
 
Well TAK mr, tak you very much
Not gonna sell you anything
Just gonna help navigate like always
And take justice’s action if you need a left hand
Just walk walk walk walk
SHE knows the score and will judge judge judge
YOU deal the justice justice for a million brutal fucking murders
 
When I ran through that park tonight
Across 10<sup>th</sup> and Pine
Fast in my best suit coat
Some fucker hacked the neck again
Pain pain pain
Soaking pain into my shoulder neck
Feels like a second head
But then again
That’s not strange to me anymore
I’ll just run naked in the failed parken grass
Jumping and arm clipping
You go left, I’ll go right
Then see you again sometime tonight
 
I just can’t see the shit
Nor can I see its shadow
 
People freak, but just the wrong ones
The right and ok decent ones see THE JACKL
A child’s favorite dream
He crawls in the depths of mud, shit, and fingernail dirt
Seeking out the fat ASSHOLE ice cream eating fuckers, next to the smokestack, and backpack fuckers
cheeseburger eaters and party downers
Assholes
 
Kids hate assholes
Jackl hates assholes more
He will climb into the deepest corners of the earth’s core
Seeking child harmers in store for the justice the devil will implore
 
Jackl’s main mission is not just hero of children everywhere
He is the princess’ servent
The jackl is the princess’ robot slave for all intents and purposes
To sniff shit out
To walk hard
 
The jackl is a smart motherfucker for his princess
Because to him she’s his queen
Like a roaming swarm of hornets and bees
He only aims to please
With a courtesy
And constantly on his knee
 
Watch him move
Sleek dance gymnastic yoga prance
Nobody fucks with him
Sight to some is too grotesque to see
Though a shining silver star with teeth in the chidren’s and princess’ eyes
 
You see one day the princess sat by the jackl
And just said “I’ll sit by you ok”
He didn’t even have a clue he was in the running
Nor did he know her game
So he just sat and stared
And she did the same
No touching
Just aura massaging
Jackl is a different jackl since that day
 
Creeping crawling churches looking for pray
 
The princess actually showed up again
In the brick garden outside of the empty (I mean, really empty) church
They just sat there, again
Of course, he had a 12 pointed ring on his ring finger
Taken, HARD
For his real princess was in another land close to home
 
He needed a reward, but not with her
A dark beer with a shot of espresso did the trick
But who was the prick
In the pink shirt eating icecream next to the burnt hole in the tree?
Motherfucker got vibed hard, you see
Jackl went into full jackl style mode
Circling like pray, talking shit silently, looking directly in his ears
You even look at children the wrong way, your head will twist the wrong way
Into the tree and it be full of glee
 
So, ok pink shirt man
Catch me if you can
Circles around your ghey ass ice cream burnt tree
Straight to the pond in the mud up to the knees
 
He was taken care of for now
At least until jackl’s laser eyed children slit pedo parents throats
 
Jackl is helping the princess build infinity
And has no room for the vermin seed
 
If the reward for this and that were to get a kiss from princess
It would last years
Jackl is in it for the infinite
A princess’ pet
In it for the infinite
And always on his mind
Him and her bind
legit

It’s not
 
Today was the day the shimmers blew the sky wide open like a hottest day at a dim shaded church, that’s not really a church, in Copenhagen, where the guy in the pink ice cream shirt hangs out
 
thank you betty james
 
Today was the day that freak ran away and the hos came out to play with their mens wallets and ALL their monay

item.title: software engineering the new testament ∞ + 1
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded: you cant write an algorithm that just does the right thing infinitely ∞ because every person is unique 1 the amount of good a bad bad person needs to make up for can be different than just the average bad person   the karma scale is unique as your dna over good can make others feel bad, having the opposite of the intended affect sparking the sense of "holier than thou" or someone who starts to "judge" others by what they haven't done, thus breaking a primary commandment as told by the old testament   ∞ + 1 is what it is, and always has been (from the dawn of big banging time to the moment you're reading this word) if you buy what jesus has to sell (free fish, wine for blood brothering, constant healing, and everlasting life), the book has said for a long time for those hip to jesus, jesus is the 1 for ∞ + 1, as the new testament says   for those hating religion altogether, because of jesus badged haters be the jesus that you believe + more of what you think he should've been to make you believe   look out for ∞ + 1, you, your uniqueness, and beautiful You, an evolved jesus (a jesus despite bullying in social media, for example)   ∞ + 1 is the objective no matter what you believe be unique, be different, be your own custom jesus i firmly believe every motion you make is driven by instinctual goodness and badness the super ego and id arm wrestling over what the ego should be doing   look out for #1 by giving your time to those in need, unless you're the 1 in need if you're not sure, or are unsure of your next action, just add another ∞ + 1 + 1   life rules, greed drools, riches of fools gold [paypal_donation_button align="center" price="1"]

item.title: human cattle for the slaughter games
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded:
it doesn't matter if you woke up first
i have the glasses of control as first student
and won't give it up, until ...
 
why do they keep fucking with you
she said
she reminded me of big K, and her heart was in the right place
inside my chest, ready to walk a short distance in my shoes
we laid naked in one frame inside a toaster oven built for cattle.
the food sucked. fucking balony sandwiches
not a good time at all
the most fun was listening to the heros converse about how far they'd gotten. we learned a lot from them, but i'm not sure how much. the core just kept taking it in, waiting for the right time to release said intelligence into my frontal lobe.
 
when they change locks, no one in the universe can find you
except maybe lg sugar cookie
sugar cookie was smart enough to know every combination
simply because she invented the lock
and knew enough to know their combination didn't do shit
just kept the cage on the same planet
her planet
 
earth, her thesis among the gods, who've wanted to blow it to bits for sometime as it's now sucking life from the entire universe.
 
even black aliens are getting swallowed by greedy greens left and right. jaded by the media, full on sheep on parade in hunger forces of might... just looking for blow or whatever else was left on the planet.
 
thank god she chose me for first student, or me and intellectual big K, would've been toast (again and again and again)
 
this wasn't just a challenge. this was for survival
"don't hesitate jaemz, make me proud"
 
a place for me and big K to weasel out of together
when the toaster blows
do we hit the deck or ram the door?
 
i had an idea. make them think they're in control for the show, make a couple quick steps while they're not paying attention, and go back to those breadcrumbs of time to scare the shit out of them... they get scared shitless when they realize their badges don't mean shit in anarchy season.
 
"oh no, don't ram the door, or my dog will attack you, and i promise you'd rather be toasted alive"
 
"don't fucking hesitate either, make your move"
 
the shit worked, and at the last minute sugar cookie gave us a break
hide under the white monolith when the toaster door blows
 
worked like a charm
thank god it worked like a charm, but then shit got really weird
 
big k and i thought we were dreaming, until we realized, that waking up feeling when we were never sleeping.
 
all we could think was, "this is gonna suck"
till i found the combination: infinity plus one

item.title: poem for keylime
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded:
Born under God
I've always thought odd
Nuclear families never work
Dude always becomes a jerk
 
Not the life for me
My kids have grown
Now she's free
 
Submit my body for a spin
Glistening sweat silk marble skin
Waves hit the ocean
Love's quiet lotion
 
I can hear your heart
I can feel your pulse
We can't get anymore close
 
Her silent presence beneath my wings
I face the world
And take care of things
Loud is my voice
Peace it sings
 
On my travels
Through the wind swept wet dark pine corridors
Her voice in my head, smile on my mind, words on my phone
My 'dianne' if you will, mr. cooper
Cherry pie, 6-shot americano
Drive drive drive
Over the mountains
4 passes of white knuckle stoke
Document my mind
Smell the smoke
  [paypal_donation_button align="center" price="1"]

item.title: God Help the Girl - movie review notes from a mental
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded:
god help the girl review This movie rules.  I’ve been psyched for it since the album came out, and it's better than expected.  I’ve struggled with mental illness, co-facilitate a Bipolar Support group here in Seattle, and can identify with Eve’s behavior. Eves good and bad Habits of being mentally ill:
  • Eve exercises regularly on her soccer team.
  • Eve takes her meds. She doesn't appear to enjoy them, but does it anyway. She's making an effort to get better. It's hard when meds are bashed.
  • Eve talks and listens to her therapist, but hates the hospital.
  • Eve is insanely brilliant and stylish.
  • Deals with the stigma when the boy visits her in the hospital, and talks about telling cassie
  • Extremely artistic and creative.
  • Promiscuous with the Swiss German dude.
  • Movie ends with a sobering feeling, like when your manic up adventure is over, and you must move back to the real world.
  • This movie helps ease the social stigma of mental illness.
thank you stuart murdoch, you rule always brother [paypal_donation_button align="center" price="1"]

i'm not shitting you
i remember this shit like it wasn't a dream
wait till i talk about pierce county and fife motherfuckers
the tall man wasn't fucking around
that tall black espresso drink had magical powers
directly connected to the white sheets that shown on my bed at that red lion hotel
i didn't know how to do it, but i bet my hypothalamus did
when i showed the front desk "the picture" the tall man came out of the shadows
and escorted me right to my room, and not room 160
a room i paid for with my own god damn money
i drank that espresso like it was water
pouring black dots into my core
to get ready for what was about to happen
human mitosis
lg had killed herself, and her soul was in me
i needed to split her out to be with her
in a different place than just my telepathic thoughts
thanks to the tall man, there was more of her soul in the bath tub
cool sparkling tiny robots crawling to the surface
i submerged and swallowed a tad bit
it was a hail mary
and the right thing to do
laid flat on that neon white sheet with neon black soot of espresso comforting my soul
"are you ok"
"yes, i'm ok"
"can you take over lg, i have no fucking clue how to do this"
"sure"
nose started splitting into two noses first off
"blow out more mucus dude, and this will be quick as fuck"
"can't wait to see you, can't wait to hang"
unfortunately, space cowboys stole her after lg sugar cookie helped
me complete the split without my needing to kill myself
to split the lungs
i remember it like yesterday

item.title: end of the world 2004 following spokanimals
item.dc:creator: jaemzware
item.content:encoded: the spokanimals journey is no small story. the essay that fit into 3 pages could easily expand into 20,000. there is so much detail and stuff that i just let it leak out a little at a time as it rolls to the top of my brain. i still can't tell if swallowing my own lung butter is a good thing. for one, i want to get the evil out of me; however, could i get the energy out of the evil and turn it into something good? the world ended at the end of spokanimals in 2004, because i fucking won. i survived. but the key to my survival was quite ironic. i like scary movies. my dad brought me up on them, but i don't like scary reality. though i also have an open heart. the open heart is what gets me in trouble because it opens one up to demon posession. being nice to everything isnt always the key to survival (), but it was this time. "i won" yay "nothing" when i say nothing i mean the world ended at the end of the spokanimals walk in 2004. i won because i allowed myself to be posessed by Bob (left him in a denmark hotel this trip though). bob had a great idea. "Chinese soup". after eating chinese soup, the people who were too black (evil as fuck) or too white (pretend to pray from a facade, but still evil as fuck) saw me as their most frightening enemy (like cokie monster or evil nacho). the others saw me as just me, jaemz. turn out the suicide rate in 2004 reached an all time high. i was given the choice to float away, or try again. i opted to try again. like i told that terrorist dude in copenhagen after he appeared out of the fucking blue. give me a year to clean up, and you clean your shit too. think globally, act locally, like, duh. then i'll reach out and rebuild once you're satified my poison won't go too far this time. just remember, the world is becoming a better place for you and your hogbitch girlfriend (-revco).   [paypal_donation_button align="left" border="0" price="1"]

item.title: European stress.
item.dc:creator: magnus
item.content:encoded: Prewords.  This was originally a schoolassignment specially made for my teacher, but i wanted to share with everybody, so you can read how the europeans stay happy. A twisted sarcastic trippy seflbiography, that I made a sunday evening, while I fought my hungover from saturdays flood. This is about to get weird, so grab a redbull, some marshmallows, some slices of watermelon and whatever else you use to stay awake on a tuesday night.     Who am I? Yeah. Who am I? Is that the question? Is this supposed to be some sort of self biography? Or do you want this to be an easy way to introduce myself? Should I write this as freeminded as possible, just so you can tell me how wrong this is? Incase that’s what you’re going for, the best answer I can come up with is, WHO ARE YOU? I’ve done stuff throughout the years, that isn’t exactly following the rules, when it comes to writing. What rules, you might ask. Well, the rules, that everybody think dominates the stereotypical writing. In school, you get told, that those rules are supposed to be followed. If you’re writing a fairytale, you need specific numbers to appear such as 3. Do you really think J.R.R Tolkien made his books depend on those rules?   - Hi kids, today you’re going to analyze The Hobbit. And incase you want to become a writer, just give up already. You’re just another tiny being, who shouldn't think you’re special.   That might be a rough example, but admit it. That’s what teachers tell kids in schools these days. Just give up being a freeminded individual, and do as everybody. Get a good education, work your ass out, and retire at age 70. That’s called a waste of life. Lots of people think that’s just the way of living, but they’re blind. I know I’m getting off track, but I had to get this out of the way, before I could start this “self biography”. BTW please tell me, if you think this is the worst pile of misunderstanding and nonsense talk you’ve ever heard. Who am I? My name is Magnus H. Dyhrfjeld. I live in Gabøl (20km from Haderslev), I attend gymnasium and I’m what most people see as a weird guy. I might be weird, but I’d rather see myself as a misunderstood person. Life's too short, to act like everyone else. I have a big dream of becoming a big hollywood actor at some point in my life. That’s one of the reasons why I had a hard time in school. I wanted to become something different from the average person, and that’s not really “educational material”, if you ask the average teacher. I have so many big dreams in life, and i don’t want to spoil them, by taking advice from a teacher, who tells me to give up. By the time you’re reading this, you think I’m a lunatic. But I bet my last pack of ramen noodles, that when I become a big accepted actor, you will show people this self biography, and say -Magnus made this back in his gymnasium days. You will tell people of what kind of unique and freethinking character I was as a student. But until then, you’ll think I’m the weirdest person to walk this earth, and tell me how I misunderstood this assignment. And I’m fine with that. Your opinion doesn’t mean anything to me. Either you hate this, or you see the real meaning of this, and understand me. That might be really hard though. You can grade this -03, and i wouldn’t care at all. This is really just me writing all my thoughts down, and I’m really happy, that you told us to make this assignment. I’ve been keeping so many feelings inside of me for too long, and now I’m finally able to let them out. That might be, why this is hard to understand. All in all, this is just a collage of thoughts thrown in a giant bin filled with messed up thoughts. I keep going off topic, so let’s start from the very beginning. I was born on Fensmarksvej in Næstved. I saw this world for the first time while you were asleep. Literally. On April 3rd 1999 about 00:14 I was born. Oh ya it was in the spring break, so you might have been up late. Then you might actually have been awake. When I was about 1 year old, I moved to Farum. It’s a tiny town about 20km from Copenhagen. That was when I started saying my first words. I learned how to talk very quickly, and they have been trying to make me shut up ever since. Believe it or not, but I have a really good memory. I can remember stuff, from when I was about 2 or 3 years old. That might sound impressive, or even fake, but It’s true. Unfortunately that made me remember all the times, my parents were arguing and fighting. Verbally, not physically. I’ve often thought to myself, if i could go back in time, and undo all the bad things, and I think the same thing every time. What has happened has made me who I am today, and I wouldn’t like to be anyone else. I could have stayed at the same school for years, (I got kicked out of a couple). Right before I turned 5, I moved to Jylland. That might be hard to believe, that i can remember living in Farum then, but trust me, I’m a wonderchild when it comes to that. I had a hard time meeting new friends, and I still get kinda shy, and act weird, when I meet new people. A good example, would be, when I started on HaKa a couple of weeks ago.I felt weird, and I didn’t really know that many people at the school. I was scared as hell, and that made me wanting to drop out, and go back to 10th at Kløften. I act weird, because I often don’t know how to talk to people, and I might be a little bit socially anxious. It’s very scary to the point, where I’m peaking completely, and want to leave. Fortunately I have a lot of good friends, outside of the school. If I didn’t have them, I don’t know where I would be right now. I could keep writing more of this nonsense shittalking, but I would be wasting your time even more, and that would probably make you a little mad, so I’m going to end this with a couple of “important” or “usable” facts about myself.   -I like to do artistic stuff such as painting. -I like skateboarding a lot, and try to skate as much as possible in my spare time. -I suffer from epilepsy, and that makes me fade out some times, which might result in making me looking less concentrated, and lazy. -Even though I talk a lot, I’m a shy person.   When it comes to writing down facts like so, I feel like i can’t come up with any good ideas. This is basically the point, where I’d like to stop writing, and let your eyes rest after reading this. Before that I want to say one final thing. Let’s make it my new signature catchphrase. “Sorry for wasting your time”.   -Magnus H. Dyhrfjeld   ================================================================================================= james k arasim https://www.linkedin.com/in/jamesarasim join thu dorkside http://skatecreteordie.com http://analogarchive.com http://seattlerules.com http://stuffedanimalwar.com http://skatecreteordie.com:3005/skatecreteordie [paypal_donation_button align="left" border="0" price="1"]

item.title: "Shot in the light" and math screening.
item.dc:creator: magnus
item.content:encoded: Reading shot in the light, was one of the dumbest things I've done today. Not the short story itself, but the fact, that my teacher is a kooooooook, when it comes to understanding books. If that wasn't hell enough, I had to do some math screening. 40,48% right. That shit went worse, than the time I got drunk, and jumped in the pond. Damn those 501's never went clean again. Basically this is another layer of the European Stress pyramid. The bricks i used for the pyramid were made of dried out shit, just like the way they build up the government. -Magnus H. Dyhrfjeld   [paypal_donation_button align="left" border="0" price="1"]
